newsitem.title: PHILIPPINES: Manila's PHIBOR steady to firmer.
newsitem.headline: Manila's PHIBOR steady to firmer.

text.p: The Philippine interbank offered rates (PHIBOR) were steady to slightly firmer on Monday despite the persistent decline in spot rates, traders said.

"The rates bottomed out last week. It might be because of the outflow of arbitrage funds -- banks need more pesos to pay their clients who then buy dollars to shift their portfolio out of the country," one trader said.

Interest rates have been sliding in the past weeks. Arbitraging became less attractive after the U.S. Federal Reserve raised its key interest rate by 25 basis points last week. PHIBOR are the average swap rates of banks.
Average rates quoted by 20 banks were:
